subject: Re: [junit] Re: How do I extend the TestSuite

Actually, as I believe, extending test suite has nothing to do with what 
you are trying to do.  All the test runner does is to take a look at the 
class and use reflection to see if there is a "public static Test 
suite()" method to invoke.  So you don't have to extend TestSuite.  This 
is a good thing because you might want to extend some other class.

Shane

gavinlas wrote:

>Hello,
>
>I worked it out. You need to define a static method:
>public static TestSuite suite() {
>    return new MyTestSuite();
>}
>in the test case. It is not enough to just extend TestSuite, as many 
>of the tools do not use the extended TestSuite but instantiate their 
>own.
>
>Cheers
>
>
